attributes.action: Adopt the Apple / Google track and trace app and abandon NHS / Gov created app.
attributes.additional_details:
The Apple / Google app will most likely be a better app and is being adopted by the German government who have led the way in Europe by suppressing the virus outbreak quickly and effectively in their country. 

Also the Apple / Google app better respects user privacy because it doesn't retain the same amount of personal information as the rival NHS / Gov app. I believe we should trust the experts in Tech and not the Gov / NHS to find a solution to a Tech / Mobile problem.
attributes.background: Apple and Google are the leading companies globally in the mobile operating system and app space. I believe their app, which is ready to be deployed, would be far better at tracking and tracing coronavirus outbreaks in the UK than the app developed by the NHS. Privacy is also better respected.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318978

We can't accept petitions calling on the Government to use the services of a particular company or companies, as these decisions are subject to competition and procurement rules.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
